content: color palette socks by laurelknits color palette socks are a wonderful and easy way to use your minis or scrap yarn to create beautiful colorways after some thought and maths of how to combine several colors the idea for these socks was born happy knitting weaving in all the ends may take a while though  1 #laurelknits #colorpalettesocks size women s medium gauge 35 stitches and 47 row = 10cm / 4 inches of stockinette stitch in the round after blocking yarn approx 250-300m of fingering weight sock yarn shown in arwetta classic by filcolana 212m/50g colorways 101 natural white main color 334 light blush color d 977 marzipan color b 354 light truffle color e 971 sand color c 973 nougat color f needles 2 5mm/us size 1 5 or size needed to obtain gauge notions tapestry needle stitch marker sock blockers abbreviations bor beginning of round rs right side k knit repeat repeat k1tbl knit 1 stitch through the back loop sl slip_stitch k2tog knit 2 stitches together ssk slip slip knit n 1 2 3 4 needle 1 2 3 4 st - stitch p purl ws wrong side p2tog purl 2 stitches together 2 #laurelknits #colorpalettesocks with your preferred method cast on 64 stitches on 2 5 mm/us size 1 5 double point needles in main color divide stitches evenly between 4 needles 16 stitches per needle be careful not to twist the stitches while joining in the round and continue to cuff cuff cuff is knit in main color rounds 1-15 *k1tbl p1 repeat from * to end leg leg is knit in 3 color blocks rounds 1-19 with color b c or d for rounds 1-15 and main color for rounds 16-19 go to page … for color block chart change to color b rounds 1-15 knit change back to main color round 16 knit rounds 17-19 *k1tbl p1 repeat from * to end change to color c rounds 1-15 knit change back to main color round 16 knit rounds 17-19 *k1tbl p1 repeat from * to end change to color d rounds 1-15 knit change back to main color round 16 knit rounds 17-19 *k1tbl p1 repeat from * to end 3 #laurelknits #colorpalettesocks heel flap continue working with main color heel flap is worked over 32 stitches slip 16 stitches from n3 to n4 so you have 32 stitches on the needle turn work so that ws is facing you the first stitch of every row is slipped row 1 ws sl1 p 31 turn work row 2 rs *sl1 k1 repeat from * to end turn work repeat these 2 row until you have worked a total of 32 row you should end with row 2 heel turn turn work so that ws is facing you row 1 ws sl1 p16 p2tog p1 turn work row 2 rs sl1 k3 ssk k1 turn work row 3 ws sl1 p to 1 st before the gap p2tog p1 turn work row
